docs.snippet: Activity in the foreign exchange market during the last week was limited and confined solely to the British pound sterling and the Canadian dollar. Business transacted was mostly routine and moderate in volume.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 31 -- United Nations diplomats were hopeful today that the Security Council's recommendation of a new Secretary General would help put a graceful end to what had been a sharp debate on the staff loyalty controversy.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) -- The proposal of Sinclair Weeks, Secretary of Commerce, for a reduced budget for his department would wipe out Federal aid to shipbuilding amounting to $118,500,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) -- The proposal of Sinclair Weeks, Secretary of Commerce, for a reduced budget for his department would wipe out Federal aid to shipbuilding amounting to $118,500,000.
docs.abstract: Weeks proposes budget cut of $118,500,000; would eliminate 2 new liners for Grace Line, 2 for Moore-McCormack and Govt tanker; L R Sanford calls move dangerous; cites need of passenger ships for defense

headline.main: SHIPMEN CRITICIZE WEEKS' BUDGET CUT; Proposed $118,500,000 Slash in Construction Aid Called 'a Very Dangerous Thing'

docs.snippet: Moshe Sharett, Israeli Foreign Minister, arrived at the New York International Airport, Idlewild, Queens, yesterday. Mr. Sharett, who will be here eight days, said he will "compare notes on the problems of the Middle East and world peace" with...
docs.lead_paragraph: Moshe Sharett, Israeli Foreign Minister, arrived at the New York International Airport, Idlewild, Queens, yesterday. Mr. Sharett, who will be here eight days, said he will "compare notes on the problems of the Middle East and world peace" with President Eisenhower and Secretary of State John Foster Dulles.

docs.lead_paragraph: PATZCUARO, Mexico, March 81 -- A cheap and simple printing process primarily designed for production of posters, has been developed by 36-year-old Jerome Oberwager of New York for the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization's fundamental education center here.

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, April 7 -- A former State Department consular secretary and cultural attache declined to tell a subcommittee of the House of Representatives Committee on Un-American Activities today whether he had untruthfully disavowed past Communist...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, April 7 -- A former State Department consular secretary and cultural attache declined to tell a subcommittee of the House of Representatives Committee on Un-American Activities today whether he had untruthfully disavowed past Communist party affiliation in a departmental job application.
docs.abstract: subcom hearing, Los Angeles; former consular aide C A Page refuses to tell whether he had untruthfully denied past CP link in State Dept job application; says he was not CP member during his 11 yrs in Dept; W E Oliver refuses to testify on Communist cell in Los Angeles Newspaper Guild local to which he was linked by other witnesses; Dr H Steinmetz, others evade queries on Communist infiltration of Calif teachers

headline.main: EX- ATTACHE BALKS AT RED LINK QUERY; Former Consular Aide Refuses in Los Angeles to Tell if He Falsified to Get Job
